name: ViewTimeEntry
description:
Retrieve details of a specific time entry.

Use this tool to view information about a single time entry, including its duration. If the duration is negative, it indicates an active timer for the user.

parameters.name: workspace_id
parameters.description: The ID of the workspace (team) to which the time entry belongs.

parameters.name: time_entry_id
parameters.description: The ID of a specific time entry, which can be found using the Get Time Entries Within a Date Range endpoint.

value_schema.description:
The ID of a time entry. \
 \
This can be found using the [Get Time Entries Within a Date Range](ref:gettimeentrieswithinadaterange) endpoint.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specifies the format of the content being sent or received, such as 'application/json'.

parameters.name: include_task_tags
parameters.description: Set to true to include task tags in the response.

value_schema.description: Include task tags in the response for time entries associated with tasks.

parameters.name: include_location_names
parameters.description: Include names of the List, Folder, and Space in the response along with their respective IDs.

value_schema.description: Include the names of the List, Folder, and Space along with `list_id`,`folder_id`, and `space_id`.

parameters.name: include_approval_history
parameters.description: Include the approval history of the time entry in the response. Set to true to include.

value_schema.description: Include the history of the approval for the time entry.

parameters.name: include_approval_details
parameters.description: Include the details of the approval for the time entry when true.

value_schema.description: Include the details of the approval for the time entry.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the clickup API.

parameters.name: timer_id
parameters.description:
The ID of a time entry. \
 \
This can be found using the [Get Time Entries Within a Date Range](ref:gettimeentrieswithinadaterange) endpoint.

value_schema.description:
The ID of a time entry. \
 \
This can be found using the [Get Time Entries Within a Date Range](ref:gettimeentrieswithinadaterange) endpoint.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
